page.title: 10HOW LAND USE HAS CHANGED
page.content: Land use has changed over the last ten years in order to be more productive per acre.Many hedges have been destroyed to gain acreage.Most farms sell more rape and wheat because it is more profitable than fruit and hops. There are hops in store to last until 1988.If we grow more we will be over the average amount.Farm machinery is also very expensive but helps the farmer by making his work more efficient.When a farm is sold it is usually sub-divided as it might be too expensive to sell as a whole.Some farmers let their land for cattle and sheep grazing.The 400 acre Bockinfold farm has:-60 acres of fruit and hops. 50 acres of rape. 40 acres of grass. 113 acres of winter wheat. 25 acres of spring barley. 33 acres of winter barley.
